intro: Nautilocalyx minutiflorus, commonly known as the tiny-flowered nautilocalyx, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in clusters. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Nautilocalyx minutiflorus is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests.
